page.title: 10At play in Silverdale
page.content: Our school playground,is rather cramped and we are often squashed together.It is very noisy at breaktime.After we have gone indoors the birds fly down to eat the scraps of crisps we have dropped.There have even been seagulls in our yard.When we come out again the birds fly away. We play tick,leapfrog,netball,football, skipping and hopscotch.Sometimes we play Stuck-in-the-mud.If you are ticked you have to stand still until someone crawls through your legs.Then you are free to play again. Our infants' school is very modern and has grass and trees,but in the juniors' yard,which is all concrete,we have a shed and a hut for games equipment. On the playground children still play traditional games as well as acting out television programmes.
